reviews.title: Loved the Kimberley!
reviews.text: This hotel is great, especially for a 3 star. Great location - really close to Nathan Road (main road), shopping, ferry terminals and all amenities. It's also very well known by taxi drivers and the free shuttle service from the Kowloon Airport Express terminal, which is very handy! Staff very friendly and helpful. I found my room plenty spacious enough and spotlessly clean. Beds do have fairly hard mattresses, but I found them very comfortable. Rooms also have air conditioning and temperature control, so all in all, it's easy to make yourself comfortable. I couldn't have asked for any more and thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.

reviews.title: Great Location, very basic hotel
reviews.text: We have a young family and travel a lot from Australia. We have been to Hong Kong many times but it was our first at the Kimberley Hotel. Our travel agent had put in two requests to ensure we had inteconnecting rooms and on arrival when I enquired that this was the case, the staff assured me that we had inteconnecting rooms. We then found that the rooms were across the hall and therefore my husband and I had to sleep in separate rooms for the 10 nights. We paid to sleep 3 in each room and the first room only slept 2. So we had to sleep 2 children in one fold out bed, which was not very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was fine and the service ranged from acceptable to poor. We requested a late checkout to compensate and were refused so had to pay a fee. I have always found every where in the world that our accomodation was great. This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed at due to its small, old rooms and very poor service. I would never stay here again or recommend it to anyone. We will be booking into the Miramar next time, as when we went to just to get a brochure their efforts to please seemed to be a wonderful indication of the quality of their hotel and service.
reviews.title: great location but that is it

reviews.text: We stayed at the kimberley for 3 nights in november 06. unfortunately my husband and i were only able to get a twin room with 2 single beds. now i am normally not picky at all but the room wasn't that great. the beds were ROCK hard. i have never felt a bed so hard. they obviously know this as you are able to order "matress softeners" from housekeeping. i ordered two for each of us and they just turned out to be blankets..... They barely made the bed any softer. lucky we were exhausted as were able to sleep due to that, but my husband kept getting dead arms and legs.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the rooms are also TINY and quite dated. the bathroom is small and also quite dated.
reviews.title: fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Hong Kong on the 1st of September.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.liked: — Nothing, but the reception staff were very helpful. Couldn't fault them.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!
reviews.text: The Kimberley Hotel while being convenient is not a hotel we would stay in again or recomend it to anyone else.
The room that we stayed in was small to say the least. The bed was very hard. A definate lack of a decent mirror. eg. One where you can see all of yourself without having to stand on a chair.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel

reviews.text: They advertise that all rooms have city views. If the back of another building is what the advertisment means a city view. I stand corrected.
reviews.title: Great Location but shoe box size room!

reviews.text: when i went in the hotel , 50% of the hotel staff greeted me ! i was shocked !! they were smileing happily. they did everything properly and swift.should be a 4 * not a 3 * hotel. bathroom is small but big.rooms are small and old.liked the price and service and disliked the room.
reviews.title: okay . not very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok - to start, we went from an upgraded suite in Bangkok, to a perfectly located hotel in Sydney, to lazy times in Hamilton Island to paradise in Port Douglas - therefore, a central, average hotel in the centre of Hong Kong will bring us down with a bit of a bang, especially after 15 hours of travelling to get here!
reviews.title: Ok but maybe we were spoilt before we arrived

likes.liked: — Being able to finally get an original Bathing Ape top and Jo getting her Manolo Blahniks
likes.disliked: — Basic room compared to what had been used to

reviews.text: However, the hotel is fine! The rooms were clean enough, could probably do with a bit of a lick of paint but we were in the basic room so what???
reviews.title: Nice stay at the Kimberley

reviews.text: Recommend the lounge for a nice beer and snack - lets face it, anywhere with a happy hour 4.30 til 7.30 cant be too bad!!!
reviews.title: Great HK hotel at a keen price - recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Warning about Hong Kong though - you think you are going for tax free bargains....prepare in advance for what you want and I think you will be ok! I went blindly looking for a camara and are not too proud to say I was probably diddled! Probably paid the same as the UK for a top notch camera (and it is just that) when I thought I may have been getting a bargain! Know what you pay in your home country and walk away if you cant get it cheaper, its not worth it and the sales people know what they are doing too! Recommend taking a mag on prices (eg Stuff Magazine) for your gadgets so you can prove the cost etc.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay at the Kimberely
Great Location
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel was the location. There were lots of good eating places around (not to mention KFC and Maccas - although Hong Kong Style) and easy access to transport. It is in the middle of a shopping district so it's very busy and can be quite noisy. Careful of the seedy salesmen waiting for you to step out of the hotel to try and flog you "copy watch" and "copy handbag". Just walk by without looking at them or talking to them! The rooms are EXTREMELY small but very clean and very comfortable. We found the bathroom quite big and there was bath salts, dressing gowns, slippers etc. etc. etc! The staff at reception and the concierge weren't overly friendly but overall we were very happy with out stay there
Stayed here for 5 nights. No complaints. Good location.
reviews.title: Good Value
Great Place
reviews.text: We (2 adults) stayed here for 9 days, and were very happy with the hotel.

To summarize everyone else, yes, it's a great location, yes the breakfast buffet is awesome (though the air conditioning is quite cold, but that seems to be the theme for most restaurants in Hong Kong), and yes, it's certainly a 4 star hotel. I suppose the room was a bit on the small side by American standards, but it was really just fine for 2 adults.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in excellent location

reviews.text: With regards to comments about the elevators being loud: we were in room 1736 which is right next to the elevator, and we didn't find it to be a problem at all. If we really tried to listen for it, we could hear the bell when the elevator arrived at the floor, but otherwise it was just something we didn't notice at all, even while in bed.
reviews.title: Good Value, Nice Hotel
